For Becky, the trip takes a turn for the worse when her father's new girlfriend and her son show up as well. Before long, a group of escaped convicts, led by the murderous Dominick, take the family hostage. However, they haven't reckoned on the rage and resourcefulness of Becky as they seek a precious item. Thriller, starring Lulu Wilson, Kevin James and Joel McHale

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe is ordered to track down two OAP fraudsters - but he seems more interested in getting his hands on their recipe for bread-and-butter pudding. Guest starring Joan Sims, with Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: When faced with a hefty dentist bill, Lovejoy agrees to settle it by investigating the alleged death by drowning of Terence Sullivan, a fellow antiques dealer. It doesn't take long to determine that Sullivan is still alive, having taken up residence with an attractive stewardess. When Charlotte sees Lovejoy's caring side towards the 'widow', she feels she may have misjudged his character and finally gives in to his seductive charm. Pete Postlethwaite guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Holby City

programme.title: Casualty

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As Dale Smith pulls Reg Hollis from the burning building, Tony Stamp tries to resuscitate the unconscious cop. The search is on for Gary Best's dad, who's been kidnapped by the drug dealers, and things look bleak when a bloodstained jacket is found. Polly Page's murder trial begins, and the prosecution immediately set out to make her look like a money-grabbing black widow

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob bids his wife farewell and sets off on a boys-only fishing trip with Terry - but guilt soon gets the better of him. Comedy, starring Rodney Bewes, James Bolam and Brigit Forsyth

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: The trio take a holiday at the seaside with Compo's miserable nephew Gordon, and attempt to cheer him up. Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde, Bill Owen and Philip Jackson star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy accepts Sid's challenge to play a round of golf - despite not having touched a club since 1939. Brian Wilde and Sid Comer star

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Peter has the difficult task of trying to help an injured Iraq War veteran come to terms with his future, and Lyle meets a woman who claims she was sexually discriminated against by the Army. Meanwhile, Gloria deals with a demanding father and Beatrice adjusts to motherhood in her own way. Guest starring June Whitfield and Peter Sallis, with Stephen Fry and Karl Davies

programme.title: Maisie Raine
programme.desc: Mallory's inexperience causes a drug surveillance to go wrong - and jeopardises the life of informant Trudi into the bargain, causing Kyprianou to spring to her defence. Police drama, starring Pauline Quirke

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Brian struggles to control his urge to drink and finds refuge in a commune at the centre of the team's investigation into the death of a university student. The case also helps Gerry to face up to his relationship with Emily - who has not spoken to him since she discovered the truth about the DNA test at Ricky Hanson's trial. Police drama, starring Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A pub landlady is stabbed to death and has the tip of her little finger cut off, and while Leo and Jack collect mounting evidence that her husband was responsible, Nikki remains convinced of the man's innocence. When he is charged with the crime, she must convince her colleagues the woman was the latest victim of a psychopathic serial killer, resulting in a deadly game of cat and mouse as they seek out the culprit. Christine Bottomley, Penny Downie and Christopher Fulford guest star in a feature-length episode of the forensic drama

programme.title: Bleak House
programme.desc: Tulkinghorn is killed, and Sir Leicester offers a reward for the arrest of the murderer, while Lady Dedlock shows little reaction to the news. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The gunman who took Gary Best's dad is holed up in a building with two elderly residents, presenting Gina Gold with a dilemma when it turns out one of the OAPs is in urgent need of medical attention. But as she ponders whether to allow armed officers to storm the building, Dale Smith comes up with an alternative plan, offering himself in place of the hostages _ but can he persuade the armed madman to come quietly? Over at court, it's the last day of Polly Page's trial, and she takes the stand to convince the jury she was set up. But things don't look good, especially when the court hears how her version of events has changed three times so far

programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate after an ex-soap star receives death threats after rewriting Romeo and Juliet as a feminist tract. programme.desc: Jack and Strickland form an unlikely alliance that sees them break the rules to find out why a British soldier died while taking part in a Ministry of Defence medical trial. Meanwhile, Leo is caught up in a dangerous hospital siege when distraught father Tom Hancock holds a ward at gunpoint, insisting his terminally ill son's life-support is switched off. Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves star, with Mark Womack and Ed Stoppard

programme.desc: Woodcourt expresses concerns about Richard's deteriorating health, and Ada worries he may not live to see the child they are expecting. programme.desc: Ellie Harrison is at Oxfordshire Wildlife Rescue to help care for injured creatures. Plus, clips from the archives featuring footage by some of Britain's finest wildlife film-makers

programme.desc: Sonali Shah retraces her steps with two sporty couples in the counties of Staffordshire and Hampshire. In the West Midlands, she finds out how a couple have put their own stamp on a home they bought after a 2020 search, and on the south coast, she discovers how a picturesque 1920s property has become the perfect home for a couple to raise their family after 20 years abroad

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives jeweller Annelies and woodturner Lucinda the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. After investing 7,000 into setting up her jewellery business, Annelies from Glasgow needs help on bringing that money back and making a profit. Lucinda spends what little free time she has in her garage turning wood into make-up brushes. Mentors Barnaby and Dru see huge potential in her but will her first market be a success?

programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk visit Carol and her sons Keith and Thomas in Northamptonshire to help declutter after the death of husband and father John, an avid antiques collector. Then, the celebrities have one hour and 15 minutes to prepare a main course and dessert they would cook to impress someone at a dinner party

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moves back home with his mother, and half-heartedly promises to film a music video for Dorvin. His efforts to help may prove too late, but give him an idea for a new project. Despite her objections, Amy's company makes a racially offensive advert which goes viral and faces an embarrassing public backlash, prompting her to consder moving back to Nigeria. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena is riding high at the screening of his film, which goes down brilliantly with old friends and important guests from the film industry. He receives a devastating blow from Uncle Claude, who accuses him of selfishly using Dorvin's story for his own gain, and leaves him wondering whether he has sold out his morals in his search for success

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani catches up with fashion designer and Great British Sewing Bee judge Patrick Grant to find out about the growing field to fashion movement. Patrick is behind a movement to revive the flax industry, once a mainstay of British agriculture, to create home-grown linen. Anita also finds out about growing woad to dye locally-produced cloth. Plus, clips from the Countryfile archives celebrating British artisans from tanners to sock makers

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood joins the coastguard of Corpus Christi, Texas, taking to the skies with a helicopter patrol and joining a boat crew looking for illegal fishing and smuggling

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The investigators take an estate agent to court for failing to tell buyers their new flat was a fire risk. The 200,000 flat had the same cladding as Grenfell Tower, but the buyers weren't told until half an hour after the sale was completed. By then, it was too late to pull out. Plus, a special police unit investigates a cruel new scam targeting the elderly

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph goes property hunting in Norfolk, looking at auction lots in Norwich and Wymondham. Martin Roberts meets a developer from Berkshire who is developing at the top of the Rhondda Valley in Blaenrhondda. One property is destined for the rental market, another for resale, while the remaining one is being transformed into the buyer's home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle provide an update on the park's two hyenas, who arrived at Longleat in 2018. It took two years before they would come close enough to let the crew film them, but with some clever tactics, the keepers have formed a close bond. Here, the keepers try to build on the animals' new confidence with a shower

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Cornwall has more than its fair share of folktales. Perhaps the most famous is found near Land's End, where Rick recounts the tale of the Mermaid of Zennor. A short distance away, he joins a small army of seaweed harvesters who are feeding an increasing appetite for a natural food more common in Japan

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson catches up with a couple who, back in 2016, were seeking a new life in Shropshire. They now live in their perfect countryside property, but Jules is surprised it took them nearly five years to find it - and in a whole other county. He also drops in on another former buyer, from 2020, who found a dream country home in Suffolk

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Glassblower Alison from Buckinghamshire and upcycling couple Fernando and Saurabh from Berkshire visit Dom Chinea's life-changing training camp. Alison aspires to sell her pieces in high-end galleries, but mentor Allister knows standards are high and getting her work into them won't be easy. He focuses on the details of Alison's pieces and pushes her hard to improve them. Fernando and Saurabh want to turn their upcycling hobby into a full-time business. Mentor Joel gives them tough feedback about concentrating on every aspect of their work and the importance of a good website

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Peter Shahbenderian hopes wood expert Will Kirk can restore a pair of ornate Turkish bath clogs to their former glory. They were brought to the UK by Peter's mother when her family left Constantinople at the time of the Armenian genocide. Silversmith Brenton West is presented with two Isle of Man Manx Grand Prix trophies by Barrie James, which represent one of the greatest achievement of his father's racing days. Sadly over the years the trophies have become tarnished and broken. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining celebrities vie for a place in the quarter-final. Split into two pairs, they are tasked with cooking a crowd-pleasing dish that must be identical in both appearance and flavour. Only one team member has the basic instructions of how to cook the dish and has to communicate this across to get the job done. Next, the quartet cook in a professional kitchen for paying customers during a busy lunchtime service. The third and final test sees the MasterChef Kitchen transformed into a street food market, with the celebs cooking a dish that they would serve from their own dream food truck

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Silent Witness star Liz Carr traces her family tree, learning about the life of her maternal grandfather, who died when her mother was just two. She also discovers that her paternal great-great-great-grandfather was involved in the attempted murder of a prominent landlord in Armagh in the 1850s

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age (2007)
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Japan v Sweden (Kick-off 8.30am). Coverage of the second quarter-final, which takes place at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. These two sides have been among the outstanding teams so far, with Japan topping a group containing Spain, Zambia and Costa Rica with three wins, before overcoming Norway in the last 16. Sweden also boasted a 100 per cent record in their group, defeating South Africa, Italy and Argentina, and then ended the reign of holders USA, triumphing on penalties

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick roams the dramatic north Cornish coast to tell the story of one of Britain's best-loved writers, Thomas Hardy, and his little-known love affair with a Cornishwoman. Another famous writer, Dylan Thomas, once dubbed Rick's next stop, Mousehole, as 'the loveliest village in Britain'. It's here that Rick discovers the origins of the iconic Cornish dish stargazy pie

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman visits the West Country to catch up with two couples who have found a better quality of life for themselves and their children. Nicki makes her way to Somerset to call in on a family she went house hunting with in the autumn of 2020. Up a sweeping drive, she is greeted by a magnificent Grade II listed Georgian property, but she finds out that a owning a full-sized doll's house isn't all child's play. Later, she meets a couple at their new Dorset address to learn what happened to their seaside dreams after their 2020 house hunt with Jules Hudson

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea welcomes digital artist and painter Tasia and stone-carver Alex into his Makers' Marquee. Tasia wants to give up her part-time job in retail to focus on her art full-time. Mentor Sharon is impressed with her digital art and sees potential in her painting, but wants her to produce a themed collection to help attract more buyers. Alex has a confidence problem, so mentor Louis packs him off to a market to help improve his selling skills

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Toy restorers Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch greet Deborah Aloba, who has brought Lulu, a fragile African-Caribbean doll, to be fixed. Lulu's head has had to be taped to her body, her red dress is ripped, and her face is chipped and scratched. A pair of RAF dress boots and a ring crafted from steel by a German prisoner of war are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville reveal the airlines with stingiest free baggage allowances. Plus, the 'extra legroom' coach trip that left passengers cramped

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The fortunes of a determined young islander chasing her first season as a racing driver. Isla Mackenzie, from Scotland's Outer Hebrides, already has a sought-after role at one of the world's top Formula 1 teams testing engines for some of the biggest names in motorsport. However, she has always had the thirst to succeed as a driver herself in the male-dominated sport. This season she's been signed up by a team that's seen her potential and she's going for it, full speed. She's now training for her F3 debut, knowing she will need to draw on everything she's learned so far to succeed

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League star Joleon Lescott, long jump Commonwealth medallist Jazmin Sawyers, London 2012 bronze medal-winning boxer Anthony Ogogo, and athlete Keely Hodgkinson join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining celebrities take part in their final challenge, for which they cook a two-course meal that will be judged not only by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also by former series champions Lisa Faulkner (2010), Phil Vickery (2011) and Kadeena Cox (2021). The person judged to have provided the best offering will go through to the semi-final, while the others will be heading home

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Moneylenders move in on Martin's family, leaving him with no choice but to fight back. Meanwhile, Diane and Kath decide to pursue Martin in the hope that they can work out what he's up to. They follow him to his accountant's house, but when Alan refuses to get involved Martin takes matters into his own hands and decides to confront the Slater Brothers in a backstreet nightclub. Comedy written by and starring Sian Gibson, with George Costigan, Conleth Hill, Rosie Cavaliero, Sheila Reid and Jason Barnett

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: BBC London News; Weather
programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: 21 Bridges (2019)
programme.desc: Thrust into a citywide manhunt for a pair of cop killers, NYPD detective Andre Davis begins to uncover a massive conspiracy that links his fellow police officers to a criminal empire. During the manhunt, Manhattan is completely locked down for the first time in its history, with no exit or entry to the island, including the closure of all 21 bridges. Thriller, starring Chadwick Boseman, Sienna Miller and JK Simmons

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle return to Longleat where a tiger is preparing to leave for an international breeding programme - but first needs a thorough health check

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The koala keepers head to Australia to learn more about caring for the animal ahead of the birth of the park's second joey. In the wolf enclosure, one member of the pack is trying to outwit the keepers and get through the safety gates. Zoologist Megan McCubbin enlists the help of the park's sheep shearer to create a distraction for the wolves and stop them from breaking out. Kate Humble gets the runaround from a pack of pygmy goats and Ben Fogle finds out what the keepers have learned from animals who have tried to escape. Hamza Yassin puts his zoom lens to use as he helps keepers monitor the native birds around the park's lake

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Photographer Brock Elbank takes images of Araf, Scotland's first Asian paramedic, who also works with local mosques and gurdwaras, equipping them with first-aid knowledge and providing a bridge between communities. Brock's photographic projects focus on idiosyncratic and unique features, such as scars, birthmarks and skin conditions such as vitiligo, to capture the private stories behind a public persona

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Creations of the Swansea Yarnbombers adorn postboxes across the Welsh city. This group of women, united by their passion for woolly creations, routinely sneak out under cover of darkness. Their work might appear on a park bench or decorate a tree, but this warm-hearted documentary follows them as they face their biggest challenge - decorating Mumbles pier

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Homer's Odyssey, The Good Life, the history of Portsmouth, and Taika Waititi, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Home Is Where the Art Is
programme.desc: Three artists head to Chester, where the buyer wants something to mark her 10th year of singing in an award-winning choir. With 500 on offer, will it be a glass maker who works on a barge, a collage artist who re-works magazines, or a textile worker of wool who makes the buyer's day? Presented by Nick Knowles

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Oval Invincibles v Manchester Originals (Start-time 3.00pm). Live coverage of the women's match from Kia Oval, London. Suzie Bates top-scored for the Invincibles when these teams last met, with an unbeaten innings of 79 guiding her side to a 32-run victory at Old Trafford

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Oval Invincibles v Manchester Originals (Start-time 6.30pm). Live coverage of the men's match from Kia Oval, London. Last year's match saw Sam Billings top-score for the Invincibles with 53 runs from 33 deliveries, but Wayne Madsen's unbeaten knock, also worth 53 runs, enabled the Originals to claim a six-wicket victory with a ball to spare

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Aisling Bea, Roisin Conaty, Jessica Fostekew and Alan Davies take part in the quiz, as Sandi Toksvig asks questions based on a theme of 'Senses'

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain presents the quiz, with panellists Hugh Dennis, Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Sean McLoughlin and Glenn Moore. First broadcast in October 2022

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: With the help of her peers, Dr Orna Guralnik shifts her methods with Sean and Erica, while Brock reveals a childhood wound. Nadine and Christine attempt a new relationship dynamic

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Reality challenge in which eight aspiring wedding planners battle it out to become the best in the business, with six brave couples letting them take control of their big day. The competition gets off to an explosive start as the planners transform an industrial Concorde hangar under the watchful eyes of judges Fred Sirieix, Sara Davies and Raj Somaiya

programme.title: David Harewood on Blackface
programme.desc: David Harewood investigates the roots of minstrelsy, a strange, intensely problematic, cultural form. It eventually paved the way for The Black and White Minstrel Show, which, at its peak, was watched by a Saturday night BBC TV audience of more than 20 million people. David looks at the effect the series had on his own career and that of fellow actors

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers is patrolling the forecourt of Wallyford recycling centre in East Lothian, hoping to redirect some metal railings, a tired writing bureau and a collection of marbles

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Reality star Dani Dyer, actor James Buckley, comedian Marcus Brigstocke, former Gogglebox star Mica Ven and TV and radio presenter Richie Anderson compete in the first heat of the celebrity contest. The first challenge sees the contestants each given a different ingredient to showcase in a single dish. Then they have to make a main course and a dessert for a dinner party, knowing that John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be sending one of them home

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Shepton Mallet, Somerset with the teams being led by John Cameron and Stephanie Connell. While the competition heats up, Natasha learns about a Victorian gadget that combines fashion and function

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The park says goodbye to Sonia the Hippopotamus and the keepers look back on their time with her. Hamza Yassin uses his camera to keep an eye on Sonia's companion Spot as she mourns. On the other side of the park, the keepers have their hands full with a Catalina Macaw who loves escaping

programme.title: What They Really Mean For You
programme.desc: Michelle Ackerley presents the first of two programmes exploring aspects of modern life that need to change to protect the environment, which focuses on the switch to electric cars. The programme explores the obstacles in electric vehicles becoming the standard, from cost to the difficulty of charging, while BBC Climate Editor Justin Rowlatt explores if the UK is on track to hit the government's targets to stop emitting greenhouse gases by 2050

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Sidney Poitier, Greek mythology, Soundgarden, and the Women's Institute., before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Coverage of the women's road time trial, as the annual championships continue in Glasgow. Dutchwoman Ellen van Dijk successfully defended her title in the 2022 race, finishing over 12 seconds ahead of Australian Grace Brown, with Swiss Marlen Reusser claiming bronze

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his trawl through the National Archives, unearthing Hitler's hidden medical files, examining the Christmas cards sent to an African dictator, and revealing the details of an incredible shopping list by Henry VIII

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team value antiques at Wrest Park, Bedfordshire, as experts Christina Trevanion and David Harper take a look at the collectibles brought in by the public. Paul also travels to Hemel Hempstead to learn about Frogmore Paper Mill

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: City farmers Claire and Tom take their flocks to the Lambeth Country Show with hopes of racking up some rosette wins but with a heatwave on the way they need to keep their cool

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Dairy farming duo Debbie and Arthur's lives revolve around their cows, family and competition. With determined daughters and grandchildren in tow, they head to Devon's Okehampton Show to try to retain their championship title. Meanwhile, Ada and Russell have drafted in daughter Jen and their granddaughters to make sure their team of South Devon cattle rack up as many rosette victories as possible. Along with the heat of competition, Show Day brings intense sunshine and thousands of spectators keen to see who walks away a winner. Narrated by Denis Lawson

programme.title: Mediterranean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon travels through Libya, visiting areas of the country devastated by recent fighting as well as one of the world's best preserved ancient Roman cities. He moves on to Tunisia, where he discovers a mountain fortress and meets a man keeping ancient Berber traditions alive, including making olive oil with the help of camels. Finally, he crosses the sea to Sicily, and discovers how the Mafia are attempting to take advantage of declining population numbers

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: Despite a UK-wide recruitment crisis, the chef discovers how some businesses are finding clever ways to build and retain strong, effective teams. One example is found in London's Docklands and an innovative floating hotel. The owners are pioneering an on-the-job training scheme designed to help local unemployed people take their first steps into hospitality

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill gives viewers an update on her first garden, and shares a new structure designed especially for her compact plot. Adam Frost meets a kindred spirit who explains how gardening saved his life. In the Cotswolds, Advolly Richmond showcases one of the finest examples of gardening in the arts and crafts era

programme.title: No Activity
programme.desc: Comedy following the work of two low-level detectives on a stake-out. In the first episode, Stokes and Hendy start the operation with a plaster dolphin in their car, while the criminals they are spying on await further instructions. Back at the station, Carol takes a new recruit under her wing

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: A distinctly average girl having an identity crisis dreams of becoming a 'Karen', with coaching help from her mum, Karen. Original sketches from some of the best new comedy talent on the scene

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Golf: The Women's Open
programme.desc: Highlights of day one of the Major Championship from Walton Heath in Surrey, which is staging this tournament for the first time. At the corresponding stage of last year's tournament held at Muirfield in Scotland, Japan's Hinako Shibuno recorded the best round of the day, topping the leaderboard on six-under-par

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: Despite a UK-wide recruitment crisis, the chef discovers how some businesses are finding clever ways to build and retain strong, effective teams. One example is found in London's Docklands and an innovative floating hotel. The owners are pioneering an on-the-job training scheme designed to help local unemployed people take their first steps into hospitality

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Chris Hull are in Swindon to transform a troublesome sloping plot with a rotten deck into a 21st-century cottage garden perfect for entertaining friends

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team head to Homerton, east London to help entrepreneurs Rob and Haley make the most out of their two-bed house that is overrun with pets

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The heats continue with the pairs challenge, which sees the remaining candidates split into teams of two, each tasked with cooking a dish identical in both appearance and flavour. This is followed by a busy lunchtime service in a professional kitchen and a new challenge in which they must cook a dish that they would serve from their own dream food truck

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining celebrities take part in their final challenge, for which they cook a two-course meal that will be judged not only by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also Celebrity MasterChef Champions Angellica Bell (2017) and Lisa Snowdon (2022) and 2022 finalist Danny Jones. The best will go through to the semi-final. The others will be hanging up their MasterChef aprons

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle provide an update on the park's two hyenas, who arrived at Longleat in 2018. It took two years before they would come close enough to let the crew film them, but with some clever tactics, the keepers have formed a close bond. Here, the keepers try to build on the animals' new confidence with a shower

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don harvests his potatoes and sows seeds for autumn vegetables. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings. Adam Frost meets a couple who have spent decades creating a garden on the exposed chalk hills of the Yorkshire Wolds and Sue Kent refreshes her garden to extend the colour and interest into late summer and autumn. Gardeners working in an extraordinary location on the edge of cliffs in Penzance reveal the wind-swept challenges they face and viewers meet a Sussex gardener who has taken the idea of outdoor living to a whole new level

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley meets up with chef Romy Gill to celebrate the glories of seasonal food at Chew Magna Community Farm, delves into the world of no-dig farming and rolls up his sleeves to help pack orders with a thriving veg box business. He also calls into Hartcliffe Community Garden, which Countryfile helped to establish as part of our Plant Britain initiative, and dives into the archives to celebrate the best of British food and drink

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood lines up with some serious firepower, working as a US marshal in San Antonio, Texas. His mentor is Deputy Chris Bozeman, who's spent the last 15 years arresting dangerous and wanted men. After rigorous firearms and tactical training, Dom is briefed on new intel and joins live cases, executing arrest warrants on armed suspects around the city

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Seventeen contenders start this edition of the quiz, but how many of them will survive to face the 10,000 Question? Hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of the life of Ernest Rutherford, the Hitchcock films of Cary Grant, the motorways of England, and the Poldark novels, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining South West chefs try to impress judges Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton, who are joined on the panel by the Rev Richard Coles. They are competing to cook at the final banquet, which takes place this year at Abbey Road Studios to mark 50 years since the Beatles played live together for the last time

programme.title: Live Cycling
programme.desc: Coverage of the men's individual time-trial, as the annual event continues in Glasgow. Norway's Tobias Foss won his maiden rainbow jersey in last year's race, finishing narrowly ahead of Swiss silver medallist Stefan Kung, with Belgian Remco Evenepoel claiming bronze

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Capesthorne Hall in Cheshire, where Anita Manning falls in love with a pair of Pilkington vases and Mark Stacey finds an unusual lightbulb. Paul also goes behind the scenes of Capesthorne to find out what it takes to keep a stately home running

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Northern Superchargers v Oval Invincibles (Start-time 6.30pm). Live coverage of the men's match from Headingley, Leeds, where the visitors will hope for a repeat of last season's thrilling three-wicket victory. A brilliant knock by Adam Lyth of 79 runs from 33 balls helped the Superchargers post a competitive total of 157/7, but the Invincibles relentlessly chased their target down, thanks in part to Sam Curran's 60 runs from 39 deliveries

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob head to a lake deep in the Surrey Hills, an area of outstanding natural beauty. As they approach the gates to the lake, they set their eyes and their hearts on catching big carp from the yet undisturbed and tranquil waters. Plus, Dr Anand Patel, an expert in men's health, joins Bob for a chat about weight

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Part one of two. Celebrating LGBT+ stand-up comedy at the BBC, showcasing the funniest moments from stars who have appeared on Live at the Apollo. This edition features sets from Fern Brady, Desiree Burch, Alan Carr, Larry Dean, Eddie Izzard, Joe Lycett and Zoe Lyons

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Golf: The Women's Open
programme.desc: Highlights of day two of the Major Championship from Walton Heath in Surrey, which is staging this tournament for the first time. South Korea's Chun In-gee rose to the top of the leaderboard at this stage of last year's competition, as a five-under-par 66 took her overall score to eight-under, which was good enough for a narrow one-stroke lead heading into the weekend's play

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham examines how when the Earth first formed from clouds of dust and gas 4.6 billion years ago, it was - like so many other lifeless worlds in the universe - devoid of an atmosphere, an inhospitable rock floating in the black void of space. However, as the young planet was pummelled by asteroids, a period of extraordinary upheaval began

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Mark Wright, brother Josh and father Big Mark's road trip comes to an end in Cornwall, where they swim with horses in the shadow of St Michael's Mount. On a visit to a farmer's market, Josh and Mark take a bite of the world's hottest chilli pepper before heading to Hayle beach to try kitesurfing. Their training involves Mark Sr being repeatedly dunked in the sea - much to the amusement of his sons. The final accommodation is a villa on a private island accessible only by its own private suspension bridge. The trio then visit the Eden Project and take in the spectacular views from an enormous swing

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Natasha reveals her deepest fears. Kristi sheds light on Brock's betrayal. Orna reaches her limit with Sean's gaslighting

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef continues his deep dive into the industry he knows and loves. This time, he meets brave and ambitious entrepreneurs looking to expand their businesses in the midst of some of the toughest economic conditions the industry has ever seen. In the high-risk game of hospitality, when do you twist, stick or fold?

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Lawrence, Kansas, Michael Portillo joins the Jayhawks basketball team in the famous Allen Field house stadium with energetic encouragement from their cheerleaders, before travelling through Tornado Alley to Topeka to meet one of the first storm chasers in America. Driving out on the Great Plains, Michael learns about the Tallgrass Prairie and comes face to face with a herd of wild buffalo

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: Life in the treacherous seas that surround the South American wilderness. The 4,000-mile coast stretches from the cold waters of Cape Horn - where rockhopper penguins overcome huge challenges to raise their young - to the far north's much warmer climate, where huge elephant seals battle for position in the heat of the desert. Orcas ram-raid the beaches, grabbing seal pups to feed their young, and fishermen are also incentivised to gather the sea's bounty. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera

programme.title: Forest, Field & Sky: Art Out of Nature
programme.desc: James Fox journeys through six different landscapes across Britain, meeting artists whose work explores the human relationship with the natural world, from Andy Goldsworthy's stone sculptures to James Turrell's extraordinary Skyspaces

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to TV writer and director Sally Wainwright about her life, work and creative process, including her early career writing for The Archers and Coronation Street. Sally talks about her early obsession with television, and how the 1970s musical drama Rock Follies inspired her to become a television writer at a young age

programme.title: Canterbury Tales
programme.desc: The current husband of many-times-divorced actress Beth Craddock leaves her for his mistress, prompting her to respond by turning her attention to co-star Jerome. They become embroiled in a passionate affair but circumstances soon begin to threaten their relationship. Sally Wainwright's modern adaptation of The Wife of Bath, starring Julie Walters and Paul Nicholls. First broadcast in 2003

programme.title: In Conversation
programme.desc: The actress discusses her life and career in an interview recorded at the British Film Institute Southbank, from her movie debut in Educating Rita through roles in Billy Elliot, Calendar Girls and Paddington. Presented by Richard E Grant, who in 2006 cast Walters in his semi-autobiographical directorial debut Wah-Wah. First broadcast in 2015

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In Lawrence, Kansas, Michael Portillo joins the Jayhawks basketball team in the famous Allen Field house stadium with energetic encouragement from their cheerleaders, before travelling through Tornado Alley to Topeka to meet one of the first storm chasers in America. Driving out on the Great Plains, Michael learns about the Tallgrass Prairie and comes face to face with a herd of wild buffalo

programme.title: My Family, Partition and Me: India 1947
programme.desc: Part one of two. Anita Rani examines the stories of four British families, one Muslim, one Hindu, one Colonial and her own Sikh one, who lived in India at the time of Partition in 1947, when the country was divided and created the new nation of Pakistan. They travel for the first time to the homes in Pakistan, India and Bangladesh that their relatives fled in terror, meeting long-lost family friends, and neighbours of other religions who shielded their families at huge personal risk

programme.title: Forest, Field & Sky: Art Out of Nature
programme.desc: James Fox journeys through six different landscapes across Britain, meeting artists whose work explores the human relationship with the natural world, from Andy Goldsworthy's stone sculptures to James Turrell's extraordinary Skyspaces

programme.title: Britain's Wild Places
programme.desc: Documentary charting a year in the life of two owls that set up home in an old orchard in rural Herefordshire. The film follows the birds raising their young amid the old fruit trees throughout the changing seasons

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Colorado, where he follows in the footsteps of 19th-century east coast men who came to experience the cowboy life. At Bent's Old Fort, he is transported back to the Mexican American War of 1848 and finds himself inspecting the troops, before heading out into the spectacular gorge of the Arkansas River aboard the historic narrow gauge Royal Gorge Railroad

programme.title: Doris Day: I Don't Even Like Apple Pie
programme.desc: In conversation with Christopher Frayling, Doris Day looks back over her successful acting and singing career, and recalls happy memories of working with Rock Hudson, James Cagney, Clark Gable and James Garner. First broadcast in 1989

programme.title: Pillow Talk (1959)
programme.desc: A man and woman who have never met squabble about each other's use of a shared telephone line. One day their paths cross by chance and he is instantly smitten with her. Quickly realising who she really is, he poses as a perfect gentleman from the South to woo her. Romantic comedy, starring Rock Hudson, Doris Day, Tony Randall, Thelma Ritter, Nick Adams and Julia Meade

programme.title: Top Hat (1935)
programme.desc: A woman on holiday in London meets a famous dancer staying in the same hotel when his enthusiastic rehearsing wakes her up. Attraction instantly develops between them, but she mistakenly believes he is a producer married to her friend. Musical, starring Fred Astaire, Ginger Rogers, Helen Broderick and Edward Everett Horton, with a score by Irving Berlin, including songs Cheek to Cheek and White Tie and Tails

programme.title: The RKO Story: Tales from Hollywood
programme.desc: The continuing story of RKO Pictures, as told through the eyes of the people who worked there, traces the films made for and by women, concentrating on the careers of Ginger Rogers and Katharine Hepburn. Presented by Ed Asner. First shown in 1987

programme.title: The RKO Story: Tales from Hollywood
programme.desc: Between 1940 and 1942, Orson Welles spent a hectic few years producing pictures with RKO. This documentary examines his time working on It's All True, a project he later abandoned, and the last feature made with the collaboration of film company that distributed Citizen Kane. Edward Asner presents. First broadcast in 1987

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Colorado, where he follows in the footsteps of 19th-century east coast men who came to experience the cowboy life. At Bent's Old Fort, he is transported back to the Mexican American War of 1848 and finds himself inspecting the troops, before heading out into the spectacular gorge of the Arkansas River aboard the historic narrow gauge Royal Gorge Railroad

programme.title: Yuja Wang Plays Rachmaninov at the Proms
programme.desc: Following their performance at last year's Proms, pianist Yuja Wang and conductor Klaus Mkel return to the Royal Albert Hall for one of the most eagerly awaited nights of the season. The couple dazzle their audience with Rachmaninov's Rhapsody on a Theme of Paganini, with the BBC Symphony Orchestra and Chorus. Then baritone Thomas Hampson joins the orchestra for Walton's Belshazzar's Feast. Presented by Georgia Mann with special guests Wayne Marshall and Hannah Catherine Jones

programme.desc: Just as Grizzy settles into the couch by the fireside, the Lemmings come charging into the living room on their new mount, the vacuum cleaner. Seeking a source of heat, Grizzy decides to move into the science station greenhouse where the temperature is controlled by a drone. But the bear is unaware of what he carries in his luggage: the Lemmings!

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have a new playmate - a walrus! The rodents ride the creature throughout the cabin, then make him slide down the roof before starting all over again. Grizzy steps in and propels the creature to the back of a mysterious ice cave. In the center is a dolmen with a bone sitting on it. Whoever touches the bone becomes docile and prehistoric in appearance. The Lemmings dream up a scheme where Grizzy would submit to their will.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: When Grizzy goes fishing, the Lemmings jump on the opportunity to transform the cabin into a giant ice slide. programme.desc: Fred and Pete are treasure hunting on the sand when they discover a shiny sphere. Whats it for? Maybe Suzy and her robot Archie at the museum can help. Sure enough, Archies clue and Suzys endless list of Cornish contacts sees the hapless duo rock up in St Columb Major. There they meet Colin, who makes silver-covered balls for the game of hurling. But what exactly is hurling? Even these two cant miss hurling expert Mayor Paul in his full regalia. Paul explains how hurling is a game played by Town and Country teams in St Columb Major, where the silver ball is thrown and hurled between team members, but the pitch consists of the entire town and the goals are miles apart! Fred and Pete soon run out of puff trying to play on their own, but Suzy points them back to the playing fields where the mayor and some children are about to play a game. programme.desc: Hoot and Toot have had enough! The twins' bickering has finally led them to separate and go different ways. But now they're lost without each other! Will they come back together in time to watch the perfect sunset at Lookout Point?

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Betty and Sargent Ant just want perfection, but no one seems to be listening to their shouting! They need a lesson in diplomacy to learn how to speak in a more sensitive way.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Cartoon following four adventure-seeking superheroes as they explore places all around the world

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts try to keep the peace among a trio of mudskippers whose home has been flooded

programme.title: Numberblocks

programme.title: Alphablocks

programme.title: Nick Cope's Popcast

programme.title: Justin's House

programme.title: Small Potatoes

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula and Amma go round to Bing's house to watch a fireworks display, but a very loud rocket sends the rabbit racing back inside and under the kitchen table in shock

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say 'tractor', and we go on a whirlwind word adventure! We see all sorts of tractors - a blue tractor, a pulling tractor, a stuck-in-the-mud tractor and a farm tractor. There's a big tractor, a chug-along tractor, a party tractor and even a trumpeting tractor. Dee and a friend also spy a whopping wheels tractor. The journey is repeated with some special surprises along the way, and everyone has a boogie when Dee's friend finally succeeds in saying today's word!

programme.title: Messy Goes to OKIDO
programme.desc: Messy gets to fly Mayor Oki's plane, but this is no easy jet and he crash lands in a tree. Luckily, robots fly to the rescue. Science-educational series following a curious, adventure-seeking and unruly monster

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Red is surprised to discover that she's not the only colour in the world when she meets Blue. Join the Colourblocks to learn which objects can be red and which can be blue, and how some can be both red and blue.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The fruit tea-loving bird-like characters, Great BigHoo, Toodloo, Chickedy and Chick, learn more about getting wet

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friend pretend to be superheroes for the day. Meanwhile, Super Tumble goes to the rescue of Shopkeeper Tumble, Baker Tumble and Aunt Polly

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies wait for Tubby Toast, then they wait for the Tubby Phone to be answered and finally they wait to see the Tiddlytubbies go to Sleepybyes. A boy in Tummy Tales waits to cross a road with his Grandad and waits for a bus

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Reau, Arlo, Oliver, Elijah, Zuri and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their babies at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Giovannas bag are colourful sheets of sandpaper, and all the parents and little ones have different objects and toys that feel rough. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding a safe, baby-appropriate rough object or toy inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The nursery rhyme Michael Finnegan features, as does a story involving Baby Bear and Baby Tiger, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring rough things too. The Baby Bear Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory lights and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: What's in Your Bag?
programme.desc: Air traffic controller Kim shows us how her radar map works and how she uses it to help pilots when theyre flying their planes

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, its Potato dedicating a song to his uncle Spud, who went on a spaceship to the moon.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea pretends to help Supertato and Carrot train for crime prevention, but she tricks them and steals a mobile phone

programme.title: Let's Go for a Walk
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers walk to a great place to draw some pictures using charcoal.

programme.title: School of Roars
programme.desc: Someone has shrivelled Mrs Twirlyhorns bog plant, so Detective Yummble and Inspector Icklewoo decide to investigate! As they follow a trail of clues, they realise every teacher is a suspect but who is the guilty monster?

programme.title: Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: James wants to find out all about earwigs in todays episode. Rory, Sandy and Zoe head to a nature reserve to search for earwigs, and Chantelle meets a bug expert in a beautiful allotment. Chantelle and Rorys fact files help explain all of James's questions. With the help of the Teeny Tiny Creatures poem, we discover that, like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, earwigs are superheroes and help our planet in their own special way. In the Teeny Tiny Task, Rory, Sandy and Zoe play at being earwigs by using their pincer litter pickers to pick up leaves!

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Eden and Ava make their very own necklaces using colourful beads. Eden kindly makes one for her best friend and gives it to her as a surprise. Later, the sisters go roller-skating in the park. Its Avas first time skating on her own, but luckily Eden has lots of good tips for her. Will Ava be able to keep up with her big sister and become a super skater?

programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Feijoada is a Brazilian stew containing black beans and many other delicious ingredients

programme.title: Maddie, the Plants and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie on an adventure around the world of trees to see how we can help look after them and our planet. Discover how trees grow, how we can tell the age of trees and how the roots, leaves and bark work. Maddie shows how trees are home to lots of other plants, animals, birds and insects who live on and amongst them and have an important role in our ecosystem. Well discover a trees leaves make energy using sunlight, so they can keep growing. We learn that a tree is alive, it drinks and breathes and grows just like we do! And well find out about deciduous trees that lose their leaves in winter and evergreens that keep their leaves all year round.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle's paw is hurt in Poodles' Class, so Vet Jess trains Mr Nolan in doggy first aid

programme.title: Andy's Global Adventures
programme.desc: Andy, Jen and Scout discover how blue-eyed black lemurs in Madagascar deal with bugs

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: A look at bikes doing lots of different things - hopping, shopping, dashing and flashing. Dee encourages a friend to say 'bike', and a whirlwind word adventure lies in store

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Twenty-Six enters Fifteen's Talent Show... and finds some hidden talents! Learn about the number 26, and how it splits into two thirteens with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Red and Blue meet Yellow and have fun colouring the seaside. Discover the colours around you with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Something Special

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky puts Dipsy's hat in the bag and then The Noo-noo sucks them both up. Children in Tummy Tales pack a bag for an overnight stay with a relative and the Teletubbies do a suitcase dance

programme.title: Roots and Fruits
programme.desc: Live from the Roots and Fruits theatre, its Plum performing the Sugar Plum Fairy Bounce and attempting to do not one, not two, but three pirouettes in midair!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The Veggies are shocked when they meet a turnip at the deli

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Glitch takes all the sand from the Academy beach, leaving the local crabs with nowhere to hide from hungry seagulls

programme.title: Apple Tree House

programme.title: Andy's Aquatic Adventures
programme.desc: Andy works at Safari World, the biggest and best safari park on the planet, home to animals from all over the globe. He works there with his boss, Mr Hammond and tech wizard Jen

programme.title: Get Set Galactic
programme.desc: Two teams touch down at the STARS space station to take on three scientific challenges to win out-of-this world prizes. First, the teams must guess which animals Sam and Ayo are looking at through their telescope based on a series of clues. Then, theres a game based on sound and pitch, as Sam and Ayo play a tune using three hidden jars filled with different volumes of water. The teams must then figure out which order the jars go in to make the tune. Finally, the teams bounce around on trampolines to feel like astronauts experiencing low gravity on the moon. They must grab as many space objects hanging above them as they can before the time is up. Meanwhile, the teams have brought a mystery object from Earth. Sam and Ayo try it and test it to figure out what the object is

programme.title: Hey Duggee

programme.title: Peter Rabbit

programme.desc: When they find an old piece of metal cable in a fishing net, Fred and Pete don't have a clue what it's for. Maybe Suzy and Archie at the museum can help. Fred and Pete discover how cables under the sea were once used for sending messages around the world and are still part of the internet today

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: The Octonauts follow a trail of deep-sea debris to its source: a derelict ship floating unmanned on the surface. But the ship seems to be haunted by ghostly voices, which a quick dip below the water line reveals to be hundreds of barnacles stuck to the ship. As the ship drifts into waters too cold for the barnacles, the Octonauts must find a way to tow it to warmer waters before it sinks or falls apart.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum, Dad and Bingo must pass Swim School

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: A toy dinosaur rampages through the supermarket and scares the Grape Kids, but Carrot and Supertato work out it is remote-controlled and try to get it back in its box

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Grandmaster Glitch tries to make his own rainbow, but creates a huge storm instead

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: Children's animation. Timmy and his friends go on their first ever trip to the seaside. They are very excited as they have their first paddle in the sea. Mittens doesn't like being splashed but she loves collecting shells. Otus builds a magnificent sandcastle. And typically, energetic Timmy does a bit of everything along with his beloved Teddy. One minute he's burying Harriet in the sand, the next he's digging channels around Otus's castle, and the next he's exploring rock pools with Kid and having fun with the crabs. When Timmy discovers an old rowing boat on the beach he imagines himself sailing on the open seas. He makes a little raft for Teddy and lets it sail around Otus's castle moat. Busy digging more channels on the beach, Timmy is thrilled when he finds a big beautiful conch shell. He rushes off to show Osbourne, who is trying to get the inflatable dinghy blown up without much success. Osbourne holds the shell to Timmy's ear, and Timmy's eyes are wide with excitement as he hea

programme.title: Small Potatoes
programme.desc: The gang meets potatoes from around the world to celebrate their similarities and differences

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: When Sarah forgets her sandwich, her rumbling tummy inadvertently starts a conversation with a frog

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran are planning on baking a sweet banana loaf for Jared, whos coming to Gran Grans house for dinner. But as they get the ingredients ready, Gran Gran realises the bananas are still green, which means they cant make a sweet loaf. Great-Gran Gran shares another green recipe a tomato salad. Maybe theres another Caribbean dish with unripe bananas that JoJo can make for Jared

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: In the Toy House kitchen, Mr Onion and Pepi Nana find the little toy tub

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison is at Oxfordshire Wildlife Rescue to help care for injured creatures. Ellie finds out why rescue centres across the UK become increasingly busy during the summer months and why this Oxfordshire centre is under so much pressure that it's had to temporarily close its doors. Plus, clips from the archives featuring footage by some of Britain's finest wildlife film-makers

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood samples life working on a cattle ranch in Austin, Texas, where he gets to grips with farm machinery and faces one of his biggest fears, horses

programme.title: Defenders UK

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

On the other side of the park, the keepers have their hands full with a Catalina Macaw who loves escaping

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets Springwatch presenter Gillian Burke, who takes Rick on a walk through a rare habitat called an Atlantic temperate rainforest on the banks of the Helford River

In the West Midlands, she finds out how a couple have put their own stamp on a home they bought after a 2020 search, and on the south coast, she discovers how a picturesque 1920s property has become the perfect home for a couple to raise their family after 20 years abroad
