programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives jeweller Annelies and woodturner Lucinda the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. After investing 7,000 into setting up her jewellery business, Annelies from Glasgow needs help on bringing that money back and making a profit. Lucinda spends what little free time she has in her garage turning wood into make-up brushes. Mentors Barnaby and Dru see huge potential in her but will her first market be a success?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The artisans restore a vintage toy car that has reached the end of the road, a legal eagle's briefcase and a scrapbook charting the career of an amateur 1930s footballer

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores North Radnorshire and Montgomeryshire. He begins his journey on a beautiful pasture at Tylcau Hill near Llanbister bursting with colour from wildflowers and rare butterflies. Next stop is Dolfor near Newtown, one of the last remaining strongholds for the curlew in Wales

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat gets through to Ben after finding him in a terrible state at the Boxing Den. Whitney and Zack have a difficult conversation while Sonia and Reiss have a heart-to-heart. Patrick ponders the future

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a 1930s pinball machine, an antique weather device and a rocking horse that holds huge sentimental significance for its owner

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: It's '70s night in Judges for staff and members and helping them groove away the night are the four young members who make up the Valleys tribute band, Adrenalin. Joining them in the hall are hipsters Linda and her fianc Kelvin. By day Linda is a Gavin & Stacey tour guide, but by night she is a bingo wild child with poised dabber in hand

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: TV Presenter Dave Benson Phillips, musician Max George, radio broadcaster Remi Burgz, comedian Shazia Mirza and broadcaster Terry Christian compete in a series of culinary challenges in the second week of Heats. They are each presented with a different ingredient they must use in a dish to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace in the Under The Cloche challenge. Then, the celebrities have one hour and 15 minutes to prepare a main course and dessert they would cook to impress someone at a dinner party

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Walescast
programme.desc: BBC Wales politics editor Felicity Evans and political correspondent James Williams present interviews with MPs and analysis from experts about what is happening in the world of Welsh politics

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moves back home with his mother, and half-heartedly promises to film a music video for Dorvin. His efforts to help may prove too late, but give him an idea for a new project. Despite her objections, Amy's company makes a racially offensive advert which goes viral and faces an embarrassing public backlash, prompting her to consder moving back to Nigeria. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena is riding high at the screening of his film, which goes down brilliantly with old friends and important guests from the film industry. He receives a devastating blow from Uncle Claude, who accuses him of selfishly using Dorvin's story for his own gain, and leaves him wondering whether he has sold out his morals in his search for success

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani catches up with fashion designer and Great British Sewing Bee judge Patrick Grant to find out about the growing field to fashion movement. Patrick is behind a movement to revive the flax industry, once a mainstay of British agriculture, to create home-grown linen. Anita also finds out about growing woad to dye locally-produced cloth. Plus, clips from the Countryfile archives celebrating British artisans from tanners to sock makers

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood joins the coastguard of Corpus Christi, Texas, taking to the skies with a helicopter patrol and joining a boat crew looking for illegal fishing and smuggling

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The investigators take an estate agent to court for failing to tell buyers their new flat was a fire risk. The 200,000 flat had the same cladding as Grenfell Tower, but the buyers weren't told until half an hour after the sale was completed. By then, it was too late to pull out. Plus, a special police unit investigates a cruel new scam targeting the elderly

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph goes property hunting in Norfolk, looking at auction lots in Norwich and Wymondham. Martin Roberts meets a developer from Berkshire who is developing at the top of the Rhondda Valley in Blaenrhondda. One property is destined for the rental market, another for resale, while the remaining one is being transformed into the buyer's home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Leominster and visits an astonishing collection of milk bottles. Experts Kate Bliss and Jonathan Pratt assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle provide an update on the park's two hyenas, who arrived at Longleat in 2018. It took two years before they would come close enough to let the crew film them, but with some clever tactics, the keepers have formed a close bond. Here, the keepers try to build on the animals' new confidence with a shower

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Cornwall has more than its fair share of folktales. Perhaps the most famous is found near Land's End, where Rick recounts the tale of the Mermaid of Zennor. A short distance away, he joins a small army of seaweed harvesters who are feeding an increasing appetite for a natural food more common in Japan

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson catches up with a couple who, back in 2016, were seeking a new life in Shropshire. They now live in their perfect countryside property, but Jules is surprised it took them nearly five years to find it - and in a whole other county. He also drops in on another former buyer, from 2020, who found a dream country home in Suffolk

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Glassblower Alison from Buckinghamshire and upcycling couple Fernando and Saurabh from Berkshire visit Dom Chinea's life-changing training camp. Alison aspires to sell her pieces in high-end galleries, but mentor Allister knows standards are high and getting her work into them won't be easy. He focuses on the details of Alison's pieces and pushes her hard to improve them. Fernando and Saurabh want to turn their upcycling hobby into a full-time business. Mentor Joel gives them tough feedback about concentrating on every aspect of their work and the importance of a good website

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Peter Shahbenderian hopes wood expert Will Kirk can restore a pair of ornate Turkish bath clogs to their former glory. They were brought to the UK by Peter's mother when her family left Constantinople at the time of the Armenian genocide. Silversmith Brenton West is presented with two Isle of Man Manx Grand Prix trophies by Barrie James, which represent one of the greatest achievement of his father's racing days. Sadly over the years the trophies have become tarnished and broken. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Eisteddfod
programme.desc: Sian heads to the Llyn peninsula to bring all the highlights and stories from the National Eisteddfod of Wales and to discover how this most ancient of festivals is constantly evolving to remain a relevant cultural force. She brings a flavour of the diverse selection of performances - from brass bands to classy pop performances to classical and contemporary music. Featuring N'famady Kouyate, voted best newcomer in Glastonbury, and the Welsh of the West End, who became a viral sensation during the pandemic. Sian also catches up with the makers of this year's Crown and Chair, accolades awarded to the main literary prize-winners

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat supports Ben through an assessment where he finally opens up about his mental trauma. Chelsea gives a devastated Whitney some advice on her relationship issues and Sharon confronts Zack

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining celebrities vie for a place in the quarter-final. Split into two pairs, they are tasked with cooking a crowd-pleasing dish that must be identical in both appearance and flavour. Only one team member has the basic instructions of how to cook the dish and has to communicate this across to get the job done. Next, the quartet cook in a professional kitchen for paying customers during a busy lunchtime service. The third and final test sees the MasterChef Kitchen transformed into a street food market, with the celebs cooking a dish that they would serve from their own dream food truck

programme.title: Slammed: The Seventies
programme.desc: After winning a Grand Slam, the star players of Wales are eyeing up the ultimate test - a British and Irish Lions tour against the All Blacks - but what will happen in New Zealand will change the life of the prodigiously talented outside half, Barry John

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: After builders discovered a skeleton wrapped in a carpet in a garden in Cardiff, forensic artist Richard Neave was called in to work with the skull to create a clay bust of what the face may have looked like. The victim was identified following a TV appeal, leading the team to revisit the case of 15-year-old Karen Price, who ran away from care

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age (2007)
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Japan v Sweden (Kick-off 8.30am). Coverage of the second quarter-final, which takes place at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. These two sides have been among the outstanding teams so far, with Japan topping a group containing Spain, Zambia and Costa Rica with three wins, before overcoming Norway in the last 16. Sweden also boasted a 100 per cent record in their group, defeating South Africa, Italy and Argentina, and then ended the reign of holders USA, triumphing on penalties

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators discover text messages and videos in which a gang of conmen cruelly mocks its victims, many of whom are elderly and vulnerable. Trading Standards Officers also investigate a second-hand car dealer creating fake service histories for the cars on his forecourt, as well as traders selling knives to children

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is delighted with the quirky original features he finds in a house in Staffordshire, and Tommy Walsh meets a sports insurer who is keen to try out his DIY skills on an end-of-terrace in Suffolk. Martin Roberts, meanwhile, is surprised by the extra benefits that come with a pair of old garages in south London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the latest contest from Epsom in Surrey, with the reds and the blues led by experts Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. Plus, Eric heads to Wimbledon Common in the hope of finding out more about children's favourite The Wombles

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Hamza and the keepers get never-seen-before footage of inside the tigers' mouths in an effort to ascertain the state of their teeth. They also try to ascertain the animals' individual personality traits by onbserving the way they play with a ball. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick roams the dramatic north Cornish coast to tell the story of one of Britain's best-loved writers, Thomas Hardy, and his little-known love affair with a Cornishwoman. Another famous writer, Dylan Thomas, once dubbed Rick's next stop, Mousehole, as 'the loveliest village in Britain'. It's here that Rick discovers the origins of the iconic Cornish dish stargazy pie

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman visits the West Country to catch up with two couples who have found a better quality of life for themselves and their children. Nicki makes her way to Somerset to call in on a family she went house hunting with in the autumn of 2020. Up a sweeping drive, she is greeted by a magnificent Grade II listed Georgian property, but she finds out that a owning a full-sized doll's house isn't all child's play. Later, she meets a couple at their new Dorset address to learn what happened to their seaside dreams after their 2020 house hunt with Jules Hudson

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea welcomes digital artist and painter Tasia and stone-carver Alex into his Makers' Marquee. Tasia wants to give up her part-time job in retail to focus on her art full-time. Mentor Sharon is impressed with her digital art and sees potential in her painting, but wants her to produce a themed collection to help attract more buyers. Alex has a confidence problem, so mentor Louis packs him off to a market to help improve his selling skills

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Toy restorers Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch greet Deborah Aloba, who has brought Lulu, a fragile African-Caribbean doll, to be fixed. Lulu's head has had to be taped to her body, her red dress is ripped, and her face is chipped and scratched. A pair of RAF dress boots and a ring crafted from steel by a German prisoner of war are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores north-east Wales, beginning his journey on a moor near Llangollen to see hen harriers, one of the UK's most threatened birds of prey. He also visits a nature reserve on a bog, discovers the wildlife that has colonised Marford Quarry, and ends his journey on the Dee Estuary, where he sees thousands of wading birds near Point of Ayr

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The fortunes of a determined young islander chasing her first season as a racing driver. Isla Mackenzie, from Scotland's Outer Hebrides, already has a sought-after role at one of the world's top Formula 1 teams testing engines for some of the biggest names in motorsport. However, she has always had the thirst to succeed as a driver herself in the male-dominated sport. This season she's been signed up by a team that's seen her potential and she's going for it, full speed. She's now training for her F3 debut, knowing she will need to draw on everything she's learned so far to succeed

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League star Joleon Lescott, long jump Commonwealth medallist Jazmin Sawyers, London 2012 bronze medal-winning boxer Anthony Ogogo, and athlete Keely Hodgkinson join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining celebrities take part in their final challenge, for which they cook a two-course meal that will be judged not only by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also by former series champions Lisa Faulkner (2010), Phil Vickery (2011) and Kadeena Cox (2021). The person judged to have provided the best offering will go through to the semi-final, while the others will be heading home

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Moneylenders move in on Martin's family, leaving him with no choice but to fight back. Meanwhile, Diane and Kath decide to pursue Martin in the hope that they can work out what he's up to. They follow him to his accountant's house, but when Alan refuses to get involved Martin takes matters into his own hands and decides to confront the Slater Brothers in a backstreet nightclub. Comedy written by and starring Sian Gibson, with George Costigan, Conleth Hill, Rosie Cavaliero, Sheila Reid and Jason Barnett

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rewind: 60 Years of Welsh Pop
programme.desc: Welsh music from the 1960s, featuring classic acts Amen Corner, the Spencer Davis Group, Mary Hopkin, Meic Stevens plus early TV appearances by perennial performers Tom Jones and Shirley Bassey

programme.title: 21 Bridges (2019)
programme.desc: Thrust into a citywide manhunt for a pair of cop killers, NYPD detective Andre Davis begins to uncover a massive conspiracy that links his fellow police officers to a criminal empire. During the manhunt, Manhattan is completely locked down for the first time in its history, with no exit or entry to the island, including the closure of all 21 bridges. Thriller, starring Chadwick Boseman, Sienna Miller and JK Simmons

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison is at Oxfordshire Wildlife Rescue to help care for injured creatures. Ellie finds out why rescue centres across the UK become increasingly busy during the summer months and why this Oxfordshire centre is under so much pressure that it's had to temporarily close its doors. Plus, clips from the archives featuring footage by some of Britain's finest wildlife film-makers

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood samples life working on a cattle ranch in Austin, Texas, where he gets to grips with farm machinery and faces one of his biggest fears, horses

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The cases of a crooked tradesman dubbed the worst builder in Wales, and a serial flytipper who flees the country to escape from the environment agency

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Jacqui Joseph and Tommy Walsh follow developers' progress on a flat in Brentwood, Essex; a smart one-bed flat in Glasgow, and a three bedroom house in Bodiam, East Sussex with countryside views that is destined to be a holiday home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Shepton Mallet, Somerset with the teams being led by John Cameron and Stephanie Connell. While the competition heats up, Natasha learns about a Victorian gadget that combines fashion and function

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The park says goodbye to Sonia the Hippopotamus and the keepers look back on their time with her. Hamza Yassin uses his camera to keep an eye on Sonia's companion Spot as she mourns. On the other side of the park, the keepers have their hands full with a Catalina Macaw who loves escaping

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets Springwatch presenter Gillian Burke, who takes Rick on a walk through a rare habitat called an Atlantic temperate rainforest on the banks of the Helford River

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah retraces her steps with two sporty couples in the counties of Staffordshire and Hampshire. In the West Midlands, she finds out how a couple have put their own stamp on a home they bought after a 2020 search, and on the south coast, she discovers how a picturesque 1920s property has become the perfect home for a couple to raise their family after 20 years abroad

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea gives jeweller Annelies and woodturner Lucinda the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. After investing 7,000 into setting up her jewellery business, Annelies from Glasgow needs help on bringing that money back and making a profit. Lucinda spends what little free time she has in her garage turning wood into make-up brushes. Mentors Barnaby and Dru see huge potential in her but will her first market be a success?

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The artisans restore a vintage toy car that has reached the end of the road, a legal eagle's briefcase and a scrapbook charting the career of an amateur 1930s footballer

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Lucy Porter on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville turn the spotlight on the big name holiday companies viewers say are letting them down. Plus, Simon Calder with advice on how to save money while sightseeing

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat gets through to Ben after finding him in a terrible state at the Boxing Den. Whitney and Zack have a difficult conversation while Sonia and Reiss have a heart-to-heart. Patrick ponders the future

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team restore a 1930s pinball machine, an antique weather device and a rocking horse that holds huge sentimental significance for its owner

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk visit Carol and her sons Keith and Thomas in Northamptonshire to help declutter after the death of husband and father John, an avid antiques collector. They set up their pop-up auction at the Avoncroft Museum of Historic Buildings in hope of finding the right bidders for John's collection. Carol plans to use any profits to renovate a memorial spot in her garden

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: TV Presenter Dave Benson Phillips, musician Max George, radio broadcaster Remi Burgz, comedian Shazia Mirza and broadcaster Terry Christian compete in a series of culinary challenges in the second week of Heats. They are each presented with a different ingredient they must use in a dish to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace in the Under The Cloche challenge. Then, the celebrities have one hour and 15 minutes to prepare a main course and dessert they would cook to impress someone at a dinner party

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena moves back home with his mother, and half-heartedly promises to film a music video for Dorvin. His efforts to help may prove too late, but give him an idea for a new project. Despite her objections, Amy's company makes a racially offensive advert which goes viral and faces an embarrassing public backlash, prompting her to consder moving back to Nigeria. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena is riding high at the screening of his film, which goes down brilliantly with old friends and important guests from the film industry. He receives a devastating blow from Uncle Claude, who accuses him of selfishly using Dorvin's story for his own gain, and leaves him wondering whether he has sold out his morals in his search for success

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: British athletics great Roger Black, former Premier League midfielder Steve Sidwell, Paralympian-turned-broadcaster Ade Adepitan and Olympic gold medal-winning hockey player Alex Danson-Bennett join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: The Edit
programme.desc: Entertainment news and chat with Amy Irons and David Farrell

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani catches up with fashion designer and Great British Sewing Bee judge Patrick Grant to find out about the growing field to fashion movement. Patrick is behind a movement to revive the flax industry, once a mainstay of British agriculture, to create home-grown linen. Anita also finds out about growing woad to dye locally-produced cloth. Plus, clips from the Countryfile archives celebrating British artisans from tanners to sock makers

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood joins the coastguard of Corpus Christi, Texas, taking to the skies with a helicopter patrol and joining a boat crew looking for illegal fishing and smuggling

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The investigators take an estate agent to court for failing to tell buyers their new flat was a fire risk. The 200,000 flat had the same cladding as Grenfell Tower, but the buyers weren't told until half an hour after the sale was completed. By then, it was too late to pull out. Plus, a special police unit investigates a cruel new scam targeting the elderly

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph goes property hunting in Norfolk, looking at auction lots in Norwich and Wymondham. Martin Roberts meets a developer from Berkshire who is developing at the top of the Rhondda Valley in Blaenrhondda. One property is destined for the rental market, another for resale, while the remaining one is being transformed into the buyer's home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Leominster and visits an astonishing collection of milk bottles. Experts Kate Bliss and Jonathan Pratt assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle provide an update on the park's two hyenas, who arrived at Longleat in 2018. It took two years before they would come close enough to let the crew film them, but with some clever tactics, the keepers have formed a close bond. Here, the keepers try to build on the animals' new confidence with a shower

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Cornwall has more than its fair share of folktales. Perhaps the most famous is found near Land's End, where Rick recounts the tale of the Mermaid of Zennor. A short distance away, he joins a small army of seaweed harvesters who are feeding an increasing appetite for a natural food more common in Japan

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson catches up with a couple who, back in 2016, were seeking a new life in Shropshire. They now live in their perfect countryside property, but Jules is surprised it took them nearly five years to find it - and in a whole other county. He also drops in on another former buyer, from 2020, who found a dream country home in Suffolk

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Glassblower Alison from Buckinghamshire and upcycling couple Fernando and Saurabh from Berkshire visit Dom Chinea's life-changing training camp. Alison aspires to sell her pieces in high-end galleries, but mentor Allister knows standards are high and getting her work into them won't be easy. He focuses on the details of Alison's pieces and pushes her hard to improve them. Fernando and Saurabh want to turn their upcycling hobby into a full-time business. Mentor Joel gives them tough feedback about concentrating on every aspect of their work and the importance of a good website

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Peter Shahbenderian hopes wood expert Will Kirk can restore a pair of ornate Turkish bath clogs to their former glory. They were brought to the UK by Peter's mother when her family left Constantinople at the time of the Armenian genocide. Silversmith Brenton West is presented with two Isle of Man Manx Grand Prix trophies by Barrie James, which represent one of the greatest achievement of his father's racing days. Sadly over the years the trophies have become tarnished and broken. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: River City
programme.desc: DCI Shaw's refusal to accept Lou's plan to move to South Africa leads to a stand-off - with devastating consequences. Elsewhere, Lenny's plan to dig for dirt on Andrew bears fruit, and Tyler is shocked when Nicole ignores his ultimatum and returns to work

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat supports Ben through an assessment where he finally opens up about his mental trauma. Chelsea gives a devastated Whitney some advice on her relationship issues and Sharon confronts Zack

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining celebrities vie for a place in the quarter-final. Split into two pairs, they are tasked with cooking a crowd-pleasing dish that must be identical in both appearance and flavour. Only one team member has the basic instructions of how to cook the dish and has to communicate this across to get the job done. Next, the quartet cook in a professional kitchen for paying customers during a busy lunchtime service. The third and final test sees the MasterChef Kitchen transformed into a street food market, with the celebs cooking a dish that they would serve from their own dream food truck

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Silent Witness star Liz Carr traces her family tree, learning about the life of her maternal grandfather, who died when her mother was just two. She also discovers that her paternal great-great-great-grandfather was involved in the attempted murder of a prominent landlord in Armagh in the 1850s

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age (2007)
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Japan v Sweden (Kick-off 8.30am). Coverage of the second quarter-final, which takes place at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. These two sides have been among the outstanding teams so far, with Japan topping a group containing Spain, Zambia and Costa Rica with three wins, before overcoming Norway in the last 16. Sweden also boasted a 100 per cent record in their group, defeating South Africa, Italy and Argentina, and then ended the reign of holders USA, triumphing on penalties

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators discover text messages and videos in which a gang of conmen cruelly mocks its victims, many of whom are elderly and vulnerable. Trading Standards Officers also investigate a second-hand car dealer creating fake service histories for the cars on his forecourt, as well as traders selling knives to children

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is delighted with the quirky original features he finds in a house in Staffordshire, and Tommy Walsh meets a sports insurer who is keen to try out his DIY skills on an end-of-terrace in Suffolk. Martin Roberts, meanwhile, is surprised by the extra benefits that come with a pair of old garages in south London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the latest contest from Epsom in Surrey, with the reds and the blues led by experts Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. Plus, Eric heads to Wimbledon Common in the hope of finding out more about children's favourite The Wombles

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Hamza and the keepers get never-seen-before footage of inside the tigers' mouths in an effort to ascertain the state of their teeth. They also try to ascertain the animals' individual personality traits by onbserving the way they play with a ball. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick roams the dramatic north Cornish coast to tell the story of one of Britain's best-loved writers, Thomas Hardy, and his little-known love affair with a Cornishwoman. Another famous writer, Dylan Thomas, once dubbed Rick's next stop, Mousehole, as 'the loveliest village in Britain'. It's here that Rick discovers the origins of the iconic Cornish dish stargazy pie

programme.desc: Magic realist painter Belinda Eaton depicts an end-of-life care nurse at the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital, who also helps her fellow NHS staff to cope with their own bereavements. Globetrotting painter Belinda credits the experience of always being the outsider in a new place with helping her to develop a unique perspective. How will she go about depicting someone whose working life is spent on threshold between life and death?

Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena is riding high at the screening of his film, which goes down brilliantly with old friends and important guests from the film industry. He receives a devastating blow from Uncle Claude, who accuses him of selfishly using Dorvin's story for his own gain, and leaves him wondering whether he has sold out his morals in his search for success

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: British athletics great Roger Black, former Premier League midfielder Steve Sidwell, Paralympian-turned-broadcaster Ade Adepitan and Olympic gold medal-winning hockey player Alex Danson-Bennett join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani catches up with fashion designer and Great British Sewing Bee judge Patrick Grant to find out about the growing field to fashion movement. Patrick is behind a movement to revive the flax industry, once a mainstay of British agriculture, to create home-grown linen. Anita also finds out about growing woad to dye locally-produced cloth. Plus, clips from the Countryfile archives celebrating British artisans from tanners to sock makers

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood joins the coastguard of Corpus Christi, Texas, taking to the skies with a helicopter patrol and joining a boat crew looking for illegal fishing and smuggling

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The investigators take an estate agent to court for failing to tell buyers their new flat was a fire risk. The 200,000 flat had the same cladding as Grenfell Tower, but the buyers weren't told until half an hour after the sale was completed. By then, it was too late to pull out. Plus, a special police unit investigates a cruel new scam targeting the elderly

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph goes property hunting in Norfolk, looking at auction lots in Norwich and Wymondham. Martin Roberts meets a developer from Berkshire who is developing at the top of the Rhondda Valley in Blaenrhondda. One property is destined for the rental market, another for resale, while the remaining one is being transformed into the buyer's home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Leominster and visits an astonishing collection of milk bottles. Experts Kate Bliss and Jonathan Pratt assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle provide an update on the park's two hyenas, who arrived at Longleat in 2018. It took two years before they would come close enough to let the crew film them, but with some clever tactics, the keepers have formed a close bond. Here, the keepers try to build on the animals' new confidence with a shower

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Cornwall has more than its fair share of folktales. Perhaps the most famous is found near Land's End, where Rick recounts the tale of the Mermaid of Zennor. A short distance away, he joins a small army of seaweed harvesters who are feeding an increasing appetite for a natural food more common in Japan

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson catches up with a couple who, back in 2016, were seeking a new life in Shropshire. They now live in their perfect countryside property, but Jules is surprised it took them nearly five years to find it - and in a whole other county. He also drops in on another former buyer, from 2020, who found a dream country home in Suffolk

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Glassblower Alison from Buckinghamshire and upcycling couple Fernando and Saurabh from Berkshire visit Dom Chinea's life-changing training camp. Alison aspires to sell her pieces in high-end galleries, but mentor Allister knows standards are high and getting her work into them won't be easy. He focuses on the details of Alison's pieces and pushes her hard to improve them. Fernando and Saurabh want to turn their upcycling hobby into a full-time business. Mentor Joel gives them tough feedback about concentrating on every aspect of their work and the importance of a good website

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Peter Shahbenderian hopes wood expert Will Kirk can restore a pair of ornate Turkish bath clogs to their former glory. They were brought to the UK by Peter's mother when her family left Constantinople at the time of the Armenian genocide. Silversmith Brenton West is presented with two Isle of Man Manx Grand Prix trophies by Barrie James, which represent one of the greatest achievement of his father's racing days. Sadly over the years the trophies have become tarnished and broken. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville highlight the disabled tourists who now dread air-travel thanks to inaccessible planes and airlines that don't always understand their needs

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat supports Ben through an assessment where he finally opens up about his mental trauma. Chelsea gives a devastated Whitney some advice on her relationship issues and Sharon confronts Zack

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining celebrities vie for a place in the quarter-final. Split into two pairs, they are tasked with cooking a crowd-pleasing dish that must be identical in both appearance and flavour. Only one team member has the basic instructions of how to cook the dish and has to communicate this across to get the job done. Next, the quartet cook in a professional kitchen for paying customers during a busy lunchtime service. The third and final test sees the MasterChef Kitchen transformed into a street food market, with the celebs cooking a dish that they would serve from their own dream food truck

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Silent Witness star Liz Carr traces her family tree, learning about the life of her maternal grandfather, who died when her mother was just two. She also discovers that her paternal great-great-great-grandfather was involved in the attempted murder of a prominent landlord in Armagh in the 1850s

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Paddy Raff Show
programme.desc: More sketches featuring the Belfast stand-up comedian, showcasing his unique and quirky take on modern life. In this episode, Granny Raff gets a surprise Valentine's Day visitor, risking the attention of her nosey neighbours. Father Pat's interdenominational all-request mass puts one foot in the rave with an uplifting service of remembrance. DJ Morgan K still has no time for listener requests on Belfast's most talked about radio station, Bel-FM, while newsreader Henry Campbell offers a retrospective view of the latest Covid stories - 1990s style

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age (2007)
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Japan v Sweden (Kick-off 8.30am). Coverage of the second quarter-final, which takes place at Eden Park in Auckland, New Zealand. These two sides have been among the outstanding teams so far, with Japan topping a group containing Spain, Zambia and Costa Rica with three wins, before overcoming Norway in the last 16. Sweden also boasted a 100 per cent record in their group, defeating South Africa, Italy and Argentina, and then ended the reign of holders USA, triumphing on penalties

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: Investigators discover text messages and videos in which a gang of conmen cruelly mocks its victims, many of whom are elderly and vulnerable. Trading Standards Officers also investigate a second-hand car dealer creating fake service histories for the cars on his forecourt, as well as traders selling knives to children

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is delighted with the quirky original features he finds in a house in Staffordshire, and Tommy Walsh meets a sports insurer who is keen to try out his DIY skills on an end-of-terrace in Suffolk. Martin Roberts, meanwhile, is surprised by the extra benefits that come with a pair of old garages in south London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the latest contest from Epsom in Surrey, with the reds and the blues led by experts Thomas Forrester and Gary Pe. Plus, Eric heads to Wimbledon Common in the hope of finding out more about children's favourite The Wombles

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Hamza and the keepers get never-seen-before footage of inside the tigers' mouths in an effort to ascertain the state of their teeth. They also try to ascertain the animals' individual personality traits by onbserving the way they play with a ball. Presented by Kate Humble and Ben Fogle

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick roams the dramatic north Cornish coast to tell the story of one of Britain's best-loved writers, Thomas Hardy, and his little-known love affair with a Cornishwoman. Another famous writer, Dylan Thomas, once dubbed Rick's next stop, Mousehole, as 'the loveliest village in Britain'. It's here that Rick discovers the origins of the iconic Cornish dish stargazy pie

programme.title: I Escaped to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman visits the West Country to catch up with two couples who have found a better quality of life for themselves and their children. Nicki makes her way to Somerset to call in on a family she went house hunting with in the autumn of 2020. Up a sweeping drive, she is greeted by a magnificent Grade II listed Georgian property, but she finds out that a owning a full-sized doll's house isn't all child's play. Later, she meets a couple at their new Dorset address to learn what happened to their seaside dreams after their 2020 house hunt with Jules Hudson

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea welcomes digital artist and painter Tasia and stone-carver Alex into his Makers' Marquee. Tasia wants to give up her part-time job in retail to focus on her art full-time. Mentor Sharon is impressed with her digital art and sees potential in her painting, but wants her to produce a themed collection to help attract more buyers. Alex has a confidence problem, so mentor Louis packs him off to a market to help improve his selling skills

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Toy restorers Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch greet Deborah Aloba, who has brought Lulu, a fragile African-Caribbean doll, to be fixed. Lulu's head has had to be taped to her body, her red dress is ripped, and her face is chipped and scratched. A pair of RAF dress boots and a ring crafted from steel by a German prisoner of war are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Lucy Porter joins Alexander Armstrong for the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville reveal the airlines with stingiest free baggage allowances. Plus, the 'extra legroom' coach trip that left passengers cramped

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The fortunes of a determined young islander chasing her first season as a racing driver. Isla Mackenzie, from Scotland's Outer Hebrides, already has a sought-after role at one of the world's top Formula 1 teams testing engines for some of the biggest names in motorsport. However, she has always had the thirst to succeed as a driver herself in the male-dominated sport. This season she's been signed up by a team that's seen her potential and she's going for it, full speed. She's now training for her F3 debut, knowing she will need to draw on everything she's learned so far to succeed

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Former Premier League star Joleon Lescott, long jump Commonwealth medallist Jazmin Sawyers, London 2012 bronze medal-winning boxer Anthony Ogogo, and athlete Keely Hodgkinson join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Bob Mortimer, Shirley Ballas, Josie Gibson, Chris McCausland, Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza, Steve Pemberton, Munya Chawawa, Alice Roberts, Snoochie Shy, Chizzy Akudolu, Simon Gregson, Henning Wehn, Jayde Adams, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Ellie Simmonds and Mist

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining celebrities take part in their final challenge, for which they cook a two-course meal that will be judged not only by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also by former series champions Lisa Faulkner (2010), Phil Vickery (2011) and Kadeena Cox (2021). The person judged to have provided the best offering will go through to the semi-final, while the others will be heading home

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Moneylenders move in on Martin's family, leaving him with no choice but to fight back. Meanwhile, Diane and Kath decide to pursue Martin in the hope that they can work out what he's up to. They follow him to his accountant's house, but when Alan refuses to get involved Martin takes matters into his own hands and decides to confront the Slater Brothers in a backstreet nightclub. Comedy written by and starring Sian Gibson, with George Costigan, Conleth Hill, Rosie Cavaliero, Sheila Reid and Jason Barnett

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: 21 Bridges (2019)
programme.desc: Thrust into a citywide manhunt for a pair of cop killers, NYPD detective Andre Davis begins to uncover a massive conspiracy that links his fellow police officers to a criminal empire. During the manhunt, Manhattan is completely locked down for the first time in its history, with no exit or entry to the island, including the closure of all 21 bridges. Thriller, starring Chadwick Boseman, Sienna Miller and JK Simmons

programme.title: Scandalous: Phone Hacking on Trial
programme.desc: A look at the bitter legal battle taking place for a decade over allegations of unlawful information gathering at some of Britain's biggest newspaper groups. Told through the testimonies of alleged victims who claim they were targeted unlawfully by the papers, including Sienna Miller, Hugh Grant, Steve Coogan, Heather Mills, Shobna Gulati and Simon Hughes, as well as private individuals who were caught up in the news, this documentary examines the evidence

programme.title: The Travel Show

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.title: This Cultural Life

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

Elsewhere, Stewie worries his reputation as the toughest baby around is beginning to slip, and hooks himself up to a machine he hopes will increase his evil urges. Comedy, featuring the voices of Mila Kunis and Patrick Warburton

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The Griffin kids complain that their parents enjoy easy lives, so Peter and Lois challenge them to swap places. Things appear to be going well for a while, with Chris working at the brewery and Meg taking her mother's place as home-maker, but the youngsters soon begin to buckle under the pressure of adulthood

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers that Lois's dad Carter is having an affair and is forced to keep the dalliance a secret, but causes embarrassment by accidentally revealing the truth. In the aftermath, Lois's mother demands a divorce and Peter finds himself helping Carter adjust to life as a bachelor

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Halloween arrives, and Peter joins forces with Joe to play a series of painful pranks on his friends and neighbours. Meanwhile, Brian teaches Stewie the basics of trick-or-treating, and Meg has high hopes for her first festively themed high-school party

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Francine shows Steve some shoplifting skills in a bid to be cool. However, her son gets caught stealing at the mall, and is sent to a Venezuelan sweatshop for punishment. Meanwhile, Roger, Hayley and Klaus form Langely Falls' first Russian Balalaika trio

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Roger forms an elaborate plan involving swapping identities to help Steve get a date with a girl at his school, while Stan and Francine become air stewardesses to thwart an evil plot to blow up the sun by guest star Mark Cuban

programme.title: Iain Stirling's CelebAbility
programme.desc: Iain is joined by team captain Scarlett Moffat as she leads a group of three friends looking to win a slew of prizes by defeating Rickie Haywood-Williams, Amy Dowden, Janine Harouni and Darren Harriott

programme.title: Don't Hate the Playaz
programme.desc: Maya Jama, Michael Dapaah and London Hughes go up against Lady Leshurr, Natasia Demetriou and NSG as they go head to head in rap battles, dance-offs and freestyling challenges. Jordan Stephens hosts, with help from DJ Shortee Blitz on the decks

programme.title: Celebrity Karaoke Club
programme.desc: More famous faces battle it out on stage in the hope of becoming the ultimate karaoke star. This week's edition features the arrival of former X Factor star Diana Vickers

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: World's Funniest Videos
programme.desc: Featuring the top 10 times you probably should have slowed down a little. Wheels come off, a treadmill wins, a goat thinks it is a bucking bronco, and much more.

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records
programme.desc: A selection of some of the most incredible and peculiar record-breaking attempts, including the most slam dunks by a parrot and the fastest time to put on and take off underwear. Matt Edmondson narrates

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Brian, Pat and Connor take part in a shopping showdown in Leeds in the hope of winning a blind date with professional dancer Leah

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: The friends return from Utah, and Brooke seems happier than ever with her wedding on the horizon after getting engaged to Julian. Meanwhile, Nathan prepares for his second season in the NBA, the Scott family expects its second child when Haley falls pregnant, and Clay and Quinn's lives hang in the balance after an assault

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: Drue sets out to win back Jen's heart with a fake birthday party, while Dawson considers attending college on the West Coast to put some distance between himself and Joey. Jack hopes his footballing skills will get him into a good school

programme.title: Secret Crush
programme.desc: Smooth-talking Romeo tries to charm his way into Bobbie's reluctant heart, while Millie is going all out for her crush and soon-to-be housemate Claudia

programme.title: Dress to Impress
programme.desc: Brian, Pat and Connor take part in a shopping showdown in Leeds in the hope of winning a blind date with professional dancer Leah

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Mared from London will be given five menus, each put together by a potential blind date but Mared will only be having dinner with three of them. She'll choose her dates based on the menus she most likes. Who will she want to see for seconds?

programme.title: Family Fortunes
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo hosts as Scottish family the Mohammeds go up against the Hayes family of Northumberland, trying to guess the most popular responses to surveys posed to 100 people for a chance to win a 30,000 jackpot prize

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: Action comedy, starring Zachary Levi as typical computer whizz-kid Chuck Bartowski, who is coerced into taking the place of his former college room-mate - an NSA agent who dies in the line of duty

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Nathan and Haley struggle to cope as Clay and Quinn fight for their lives after sustaining gunshot wounds. Meanwhile, Julian tries to keep Jamie preoccupied and Brooke's legal troubles grow. James Lafferty stars

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: Dawson is shocked to discover his mother is pregnant, and Jen tells Joey to visit a clinic for birth control advice, while Jack is stunned to find out a girl fancies him and feels pressured to tell her he is gay. James Van Der Beek, Katie Holmes, Joshua Jackson and Michelle Williams star

programme.title: Dinner Date
programme.desc: Josh from London picks three blind dates from five potential partners, based entirely on the menus they have created. When the three dinners have been eaten, he decides who he wants to see again. Narrated by Charlotte Hudson

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a game show which takes place in public locations around the UK. He invites passers-by to take part in a series of unusual challenges. The first episode comes from Cardiff

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald (2018)
programme.desc: In 1927, the Magical Congress of the United States of America transfers the dark wizard Gellert Grindelwald to Europe to stand trial, but he escapes. In an attempt to scupper the evil sorcerer's plans of raising pure-blood wizards to rule over all non-magical beings, Albus Dumbledore enlists his former student Newt Scamander to help. Second part of JK Rowling's Harry Potter prequel saga, starring Eddie Redmayne, Johnny Depp, Katherine Waterston and Jude Law

programme.title: FYI Daily
programme.desc: Latest news from the world of entertainment.

Action adventure sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Charlize Theron, Dwayne Johnson and Kurt Russell

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian and Quagmire compete for the affections of each other's old flames, and Peter is furious with the local dry cleaner for losing his favourite white shirt. With the voices of Cheryl Tiegs and Drew Barrymore

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter receives tickets to a boxing match as a birthday gift, and ends up volunteering Lois to compete. To everyone's surprise, she proves to be a natural pugilist, prompting her hapless husband to become her fight promoter - little suspecting that she is using her marital frustrations as motivation in the ring

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan has his plans for Thanksgiving ruined when Francine's adoptive parents pay them an unexpected visit. Meanwhile, Francine's mother tries to get Hayley back into the dating world by setting her up with an eligible Chinese bachelor, who reveals his true intentions at the dinner table. Featuring the guest voice of Mariah Carey

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Against Francine's wishes, Stan drugs Steve and his friends to give them an outdoor experience courtesy of the CIA's holodeck. Meanwhile, after buying Roger's home star on the Star Registry, Hayley makes herself his queen

programme.desc: Keith does the big weekly shop in Asda with This Morning's Josie Gibson and goes in search of the perfect hot tub with BBC Radio 1's Melvin Odoom

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Katie tells Viv what her daughter has been up to, but her malicious actions backfire when Andy lets Donna and Robert move in. Val steps up her campaign to seduce Danny and Chas falls foul of another employer

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Val is thrilled to be torn between two would-be lovers, while Terry celebrates his first wedding anniversary, but how long can Dawn keep her illicit feelings for Scott under wraps?

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Les hits rock bottom as he faces up to a stretch behind bars, Curly and Emma try to sort out their marital problems and Karen helps forge Mike's signature on bogus company cheques

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: A guilt-stricken Karen begins to get cold feet after Mike discusses leaving Underworld to his son, and Les has hope when a homeless man who witnessed the attack comes forward

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Lady Devereaux invites Simon to captain her staff cricket team against the rival side led by bookie Bernie Miller. However, he soon discovers the other members of the team don't exactly have a spring in their step. Donald Sinden stars

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Oliver regrets an act of kindness when he offers to help a poorly Simon recover from a cold

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Ormerod and Dr Weatherill accompany Brigid back to Ireland for Moira's funeral, and uncover shocking family secrets in the process. Meanwhile, a new locum is thrown in at the deep end at the Royal. Medical drama set in Sixties Yorkshire, starring Linda Armstrong, Robert Daws and Amy Robbins, with Glynis Barber joining the cast

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Ellis confronts local prejudice when he discovers one of his patients has contracted a rare disease abroad. Jack and Alun begin a crackpot scheme to raise chickens, Brigid makes a big decision about baby Aisling's future, and Jean becomes more frustrated with Lizzie's incompetence. Medical drama, starring Neil McDermott, Linda Armstrong and Glynis Barber

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Colonel and Joan Maltravers host a dinner party to celebrate their son's return from Kenya but the meal is disrupted by an armed robbery. David gives chase to the thief and becomes a local hero - much to the exasperation of Bernie. Liz has a difficult decision to make after receiving an exciting offer from Ben. Guest starring Simon Williams, his wife Lucy Fleming and their son Tam Williams

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The police investigate the murder of an ex-army recluse and archaeological enthusiast and suspect a building dispute could provide a motive, while Dennis asks Liz for advice when he begins to notice a change in Jenny's behaviour. Vernon decides to play Cupid on behalf of his relative Gareth and sets him up on a blind date with Rosie, but does not count on the mechanic having another admirer. Rural drama starring Duncan Bell, Aislin McGuckin and Vanessa Hehir

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Terry spends a night away from home while attending an interview in Hotten, Rodney puts on the style for a night out with Val, and Chloe sees red when she discovers Syd has lied to her

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chloe exploits Syd's turmoil, playing for the sympathy vote by telling everyone he hit her. Bob frets about the state of Dawn's marriage, and Val rolls out of bed with Danny to go on a date with Rodney

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Emma is stunned by the news that a witness has come forward to back Les's story, while Joe and Karen have a close call as Mike announces he is planning to do some stocktaking at the factory

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Mike discovers a dodgy invoice but just as he is about to confront Joe he is distracted by a call from Adam, while Emma steels herself for her court appearance

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The discovery of a woman's body in a car park presents Jack Frost with another challenge to his deductive powers. Delving into the victim's electronic organiser, he learns she was connected with a local religious community - and realises someone in the congregation is more interested in the pleasures of this world than the rewards of the next. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander and John Lyons

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Merton investigates the murder of a retired policeman who was about to flee the village for Spain and, after visiting the victim's widow, discovers the man kept more than a few secrets from his wife. Vernon decides to arrange a poker night in the hope it will make him easy money, but doesn't count on playing against a hustler. Rural drama starring Duncan Bell, Geoffrey Hughes and Mark Jordon

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: First of a two-part storyline. Jenny's life starts to spiral out of control and begins to affect her work, leaving Dennis and Liz facing difficult decisions. New doctor Helen Trent arrives in Aidensfield with her wealthy husband Matt, hoping to make a fresh start, but finds it hard to adjust to the slow pace of life in the country. Sophie Ward joins the regular cast, including Sarah Tansey, Duncan Bell and Aislin McGuckin

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: A police lab technician is stabbed to death in her home and while Brooks and Casey pursue their lead suspect, another woman is attacked in an identical fashion. The second victim survives and is able to identify her assailant, but she and Casey fall for each other - a relationship that threatens to damage both the CPS's case and the detective's career. Guest starring Lydia Leonard, with Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Sunny makes further investigations into David Walker's life that suggest he was a troubled man with a number of issues. Cassie has a prickly chat with Marion about her past and the inquiry reveals her close relationship with an IRA activist. As the police investigation encroaches on their life, Sara and Colin open up to their partners with secrets about their past. Whodunit, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Lorraine Ashbourne, Mark Bonnar, Douglas Hodge, Wendy Craig and Holly Aird

programme.desc: Simon helps his old pal Oliver when he falls foul of his prospective mother-in-law

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Weatherill treats a schoolgirl whose crush on a teacher has spiralled out of control, while Ormerod and Ellis launch a daring cliff rescue when a family picnic goes awry. Jack and Alun use a map to hunt for buried treasure underneath the hospital, and an old friend of Matron is taken ill. Sixties-set medical drama, starring Amy Robbins, Robert Daws, Neil McDermott and Wendy Craig

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Continuing the final series of the hospital drama after a two-year break. Susie Dixon's head is turned by a rich playboy, with devastating consequences for Mrs Middleditch when the negligent nurse administers the wrong blood during a transfusion. Ormerod is called out by the coastguard to rescue a grieving widow who has got into difficulty on her yacht, and Jack and Alun find themselves looking after a horse after it tramples its owner. Robert Daws, Sarah Beck Mather, Susan Hampshire and Gareth Hale star

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Val and Rodney rekindle the flames of an old passion, while Chloe continues to drag Syd's name through the mud and Emily makes a breakthrough in her campaign to coax Marlon out of the attic

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Emily is shocked by what she sees when Marlon finally opens the door to his attic refuge. Chloe revels in her power over Syd, and Val plays fast and loose with her two likely lads

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: As the tension builds in court, Emma nervously takes the stand, knowing that if she tells the truth she will ruin not only a colleague's career but also her own - does she have the stomach to ensure justice prevails?

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Curly turns against Emma following the outcome of the court case, Joe and Karen plan to forge more cheques and Martin is oblivious to the fact Katy has fallen for him

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A student is attacked on campus, and Jack takes time off from questioning two robbery suspects to catch the thug responsible before he can strike again. The trail leads him to Boxborough - where a confrontation with a belligerent solicitor provides the clue he needs to crack the case. Starring David Jason, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons, Charlotte Bellamy and Tazmin Malleson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Conclusion of a two-part storyline. A kidnap case leaves Vernon's plans for Liz and Ben's wedding in chaos, while Helen's dreams of a fresh start for her and Matt look set to be shattered. Jenny is relieved when she finally gets a medical diagnosis explaining her recent symptoms, but the news brings a difficult decision for husband Dennis, who has to choose between his wife and his police career. Starring newcomer Sophie Ward, Oliver Montgomery, Duncan Bell and Sarah Tansey

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Veteran singer and keyboard player Alan Price guest stars in this festive episode of the rural drama, as the leader of a jazz band. Travelling to Aidensfield, where they've been booked by Vernon to play at the villagers' Christmas concert, the Rio Trio offer a lift to a girl, unaware she is a single mum taking her baby home to see her parents for the holiday. However, the first the band know about the infant is when the girl disappears, leaving them to look after it. Meanwhile, as the concert gets into full swing, local barmaid Gina takes centre stage, hoping to impress all and sundry with her rendition of Winter Wonderland. Tricia Penrose, Derek Fowlds, Geoffrey Hughes, William Simons and Mark Jordon star

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A fisherman's body is found tangled up in a North Sea trawler's net. Vera and her team investigate with the help of the local harbourmaster, and find the dead man's sons pointing the finger at the owner of a fish market, with whom they have a long-running feud. Retracing the dead man's steps, Vera discovers when he drowned and tracks down a waitress who may have been one of the last people to see him alive. However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead man's sister-in-law goes up in flames

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Georgia Taylor (Coronation Street, Casualty) and Paterson Joseph (Peep Show) join the cast as the crime drama returns for its seventh series. In the first of a two-part story, a suicidal man causes a train crash when he drives onto a railway crossing, killing 15 people. With Jake prosecuting, the man's defence barrister tries to prove his vulnerability and mental illness, but then a twist in the investigation leaves Sam's career hanging in the balance. Starring Bradley Walsh, Dominic Rowan and Paul Nicholls

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Marion jeopardises her marriage by refusing to open up about the past to her husband, Colin is blackmailed even further and the secrets of Sara's past push her family to breaking point. A disturbing allegation about David opens up a second line of inquiry, and when Tessa is called in for questioning again it threatens to ruin her relationships with her husband and son. Cold-case crime drama, starring Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar, with Rosie Cavaliero, Mark Bonnar, Badria Timini and Lorraine Ashbourne

Hospital drama, starring Robert Daws, Neil McDermott, Lauren Drummond and Gareth Hale
