programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brixton and Harmondsworth for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton returns to explore more of the remote and fascinating places that lie off the mainland, beginning with a cluster of islands in the Outer Hebrides. He starts his journey just off the coast of North Uist at Berneray, then heads south to Grimsay and Kirkibost, before ending on the deserted whisky island of Pabbay

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton journeys around the coast of the Long Island of Harris and Lewis, beginning on Scarp, travelling north to Great Bernera, then south east to Scalpay. These islands may seem to exist in the shadow of their much larger neighbours, but Paul discovers they have a distinct identity all of their own, as he hears remarkable stories of crofter rebellions, rocket mail and a rich local culture

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones continues his journey across Australia on the Indian Pacific. He visits Adelaide, Broken Hill and finally Sydney to discover the unique and diverse definitions of what makes this great nation

programme.title: South of the River (2020)
programme.desc: A singer is diagnosed with throat cancer, and must choose between his band and his medical treatment. Drama, starring Alex Gillison and Joe Watkins

programme.title: That'll Be the Day (1973)
programme.desc: A school dropout leaves home and drifts through a succession of dead-end jobs until he finds an outlet for his frustration in rock 'n' roll. Drama, starring David Essex, Ringo Starr, Keith Moon, Billy Fury, Robert Lindsay and Rosemary Leach

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: Hands of a Murderer (1990)
programme.desc: The sleuth pursues his arch-enemy Moriarty, who has escaped the gallows and is plotting to steal top-secret information from British intelligence. When Holmes foils his scheme, Moriarty kidnaps the detective's spymaster brother with the intention of forcing him to reveal all his secrets. Detective drama, starring Edward Woodward, John Hillerman and Anthony Andrews

programme.desc: Documentary in which rarely-seen archive footage and expert interviews identify and rank history's most influential military equipment. The series begins with a look at aircraft, from the P51 Mustang through to the modern Harrier jump jet

programme.title: Black Jack (1979)
programme.desc: A rascally French sailor is saved from hanging in 18th-century Yorkshire and sets out on the road with an apprentice, rescuing a young girl from an asylum along the way. Ken Loach's period adventure, adapted from Leon Garfield's classic children's novel, starring Jean Franval, Stephen Hirst, Andrew Bennett and Louise Cooper

programme.title: Last Holiday (1950)
programme.desc: A man believes he has a terminal disease, prompting him to embark on a final fling abroad. Comedy, starring Alec Guinness and Kay Walsh

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones continues his journey across Australia on the Indian Pacific. He visits Adelaide, Broken Hill and finally Sydney to discover the unique and diverse definitions of what makes this great nation

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: An evil demon and three witches plot to kill the disciples in a bid to bring themselves back to life. Cult adventure series, starring Masoaki Sakai

programme.title: Auschwitz in 33 Objects
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind the personal items and belongings left behind in Auschwitz Birkenau, a former nazi concentration and extermination camp, the world's largest cemetery and resting place

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert explores the Scottish Highlands' peaks and heather moorlands, where a mix of mammals and birds have adapted to an ecology that is unique in Britain. He waits until dawn to witness the black grouse's secretive courtship display, encounters a herd of reindeer and scales the Cairngorms to spot a mountain hare

programme.title: Let Him Have It (1991)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the controversial 1952 murder trial in which 19-year-old Derek Bentley was sentenced to be hanged for killing a policeman - even though his friend Chris Craig was the one who fired the fatal gunshot. Starring Christopher Eccleston, Paul Reynolds, Tom Courtenay, Eileen Atkins, Tom Bell and Mark McGann

programme.title: Radio On (1979)
programme.desc: A DJ drives from London to Bristol to investigate his brother's death, encountering a succession of strange people along the way - but his interest in solving the mystery begins to wane as the journey unfolds. Road movie, starring David Beames, Lisa Kreuzer and Sting

programme.title: That'll Be the Day (1973)
programme.desc: A school dropout leaves home and drifts through a succession of dead-end jobs until he finds an outlet for his frustration in rock 'n' roll. Drama, starring David Essex, Ringo Starr, Keith Moon, Billy Fury, Robert Lindsay and Rosemary Leach

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

The teams have only ever met five times since their first meeting in 1985, with the home side only coming out on top once in those five fixtures. The last game between the teams was also in the League Cup in 2019, when the visitors won 3-1
